posts.post_content:

Because not every red common can be [lightning bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=lightning bolt).

Posted By: desolation_masticore (1/19/2011 4:46:31 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I have nothing against vanilla creatures. This is just a bad vanilla creature.  
  
@desolation\_masticore:  
Yes, but red could also have instead gotten its years-overdue ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) [Grizzly Bear](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grizzly Bear).  
Black, of all colors, has one now. Giving red—an *aggro color*—a grizzly bear isn't going to make everyone quit playing and bring about an apocalypse of widespread ruin.  
I could easily say the same thing about that [Walking Corpse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Walking Corpse), you know...
posts.html:
I have nothing against vanilla creatures. This is just a bad vanilla creature.

@desolation_masticore:
Yes, but red could also have instead gotten its years-overdue Grizzly Bear.
Black, of all colors, has one now. Giving red—an aggro color—a grizzly bear isn't going to make everyone quit playing and bring about an apocalypse of widespread ruin.
I could easily say the same thing about that Walking Corpse, you know...

Posted By: onlainari (4/19/2009 10:29:02 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
[Grizzly Bears](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grizzly Bears) and [Centaur Courser](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Centaur Courser) are weak creatures, giving each color these weak cards wont ruin the game, because they wont get played regardless.   
  
All it will do is increase the power level of budget players decks, and their is nothing wrong with that. Weak cards dont define formats, strong cards do. Heck even Urza and Mirrodin had its weak cards, but they didnt slow down the powerhouses that are legacy staples to this day, did they?  
  
You could give green a common [watchwolf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=watchwolf) for ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol), and a 4/4 for ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol).
posts.html:
Grizzly Bears and Centaur Courser are weak creatures, giving each color these weak cards wont ruin the game, because they wont get played regardless.

All it will do is increase the power level of budget players decks, and their is nothing wrong with that. Weak cards dont define formats, strong cards do. Heck even Urza and Mirrodin had its weak cards, but they didnt slow down the powerhouses that are legacy staples to this day, did they?

You could give green a common watchwolf for , and a 4/4 for .
